Kanit (Ham) Wongsuphasawat.

[pronounced Guh-nit (Ham) Wohng-soo-puh-suh-wuhd]

Kanit is a PhD Student at the University of Washington’s Computer Science & Engineering Department, where he works with Prof. Jeffrey Heer on Human-computer Interaction (HCI) and Information Visualization. My specific interest is developing interactive systems for visual analysis, communication, and design.

Formerly, Kanit worked at Tableau Software’s Visual Analysis Research Group, at Google’s HCI group. Kanit holds a MS in Management Science & Engineering from Stanford University, where he worked with Scott Klemmer in the Stanford HCI Group and a B.Eng in Computer Engineering (First Honor and Gold Medal) from Chulalongkorn University in Thailand.

Besides work, Kanit loves playing soccer and is a big fan of Manchester United FC. He also loves movies, books and photography.

Please also feel free to look at his projects and his full personal bio.

Email: kanitw [at] gmail.com
Twitter: @kanitw
